thread.title: Prairie Community Bank hosts workshop on chip technology - Northwest Herald
thread.title_full: Prairie Community Bank hosts workshop on chip technology - Northwest Herald

title: Prairie Community Bank hosts workshop on chip technology - Northwest Herald
text:
Prairie Community Bank hosts workshop on chip technology Published: Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015 5:30 a.m. CDT 
MARENGO – Prairie Community Bank in Marengo recently hosted a workshop for area businesses on the new chip technology in credit and debt cards, according to a news release. 
A dozen businesses from McHenry County attended the event, where employees at Prairie Community Bank discussed compliance issues businesses face with the new chip mandate. The chip card technology encrypts a customer’s account information, improving security and fraud protection. 
The workshop in Marengo covered compliance issues along with an overview on the merchant’s responsibilities and liabilities associated with accepting chip card purchases. 
“Protecting our customers is a top priority at Prairie Community Bank,” President and CEO Dianna Torman said in the release. “By implementing this technology, our customers are even safer when making debit card purchases.” 
Businesses had an Oct. 1 deadline to convert card reader systems and equipment to accommodate the new chip technology, but the conversion has been slow with many transactions still being made on cards with magnetic strips, according to the Associated Press. 
To learn more about the chip card technology, interested residents can visit Prairie Community Bank locations in Marengo and Union.
